result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Karleigh

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony J Karleigh in court.  Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden in court for Anthony J Karleigh.  Atty. McFadden advises that he has received all of the discovery as well as an offer but needs time to review it with his client.  Atty. McFadden requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Anthony J Karleigh in court.  Court advises the defendant of his right to counsel.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises that he plans to proceed without counsel as he cannot afford a private attorney.  State recites the offer.  Defendant advises he was not provided an offer and presents additional statements.  Court advises the defendant that if he does not qualify for a Public Defender he could petition the court for an attorney.  Defendant advises he called the Public Defender's office and they advised he does not qualify.  Court will provide the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Attorney and take a recess to allow time for the defendant to complete the petition today.  Court takes a break at 8:41 a.m.  Case recalled at 8:56 AM; all appearances remain the same.  Court reviews the completed petition for court appointed attorney.  Court grants the petition, and orders repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 9/15/2022.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 3-4 weeks.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A-D/Wisconsin On Tap listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

8:46 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Anthony J Karleigh in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
